comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: According to this map on Wikipedia, there was only ever one junction near Enfiled, Nesbitt Junction. The left hand line is a branch headed for Edenderry, which closed in 1963. I believe the photo was taken near this green arrow. The curved path of the closed line is still visible in the hedges before disappearing under the new motorway.

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: Thanks, great photo, although it's not exactly the one I was expected as the loco is not bonnet first but I am convinced he has one at Nesbitt somewhere, but never the less an interesting image all the same cheers! Yes that line curving away is the branch line to Edenderry.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Nesbitt Junction and the branch line to Edenderry can be seen clearer in the 1995 B/W aerial photo. maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,675406,741025,6,5 Switch to the Historic 25 inch map for more detail. It's great that the OSI have published these old aerial photos.

comment._content: Irish Grid to lat/long www.fieldenmaps.info/cconv/cconv_ie.html Easting 675406 = -6.86573591 Northing 741025 = 53.41395754, Lat/long = 53.41395754, -6.86573591 maps.google.ie/maps?q=53.41395754,+-6.86573591&hl=en&...

comment.author: 47121377@N00
comment._content: It's a real shame there are so many unused lines now. I know there are efforts in Kilmacthomas, Waterford to do something with the remaining line, it can't go eastwards as the Union Road Bridge was removed to facilitate the new N25 route. There is a facebook group for the area.

comment.author: 67857715@N03
comment._content: They stopped running this class bonnet-first after an accident when the driver was unable to hear the detonator going off.
